summary: The Uterine Cancer Study Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to conduct a study on the relationship between hair straighteners and uterine cancer, with a focus on women of color. The study, in coordination with the FDA and NIH, will review existing research, consider impacts across racial and ethnic groups, analyze the effects of hair straighteners with different chemical components, and assess whether the FDA should impose more testing requirements. The Secretary must submit a methodology description to relevant congressional committees within 45 days of enactment, begin the study within 180 days, and deliver a report with results within two years.
